alert.note: Alert for Baraga; Marquette (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 22 at 11:35AM EST until February 23 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow. Additional snow accumulations of 6 to 14 inches, greatest in the higher terrain from Herman to the Dead River Storage Basin, to Ishpeming and Negaunee. * WHERE...Baraga and Marquette Counties. * WHEN...Until 7 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility, especially tonight. The hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero late tonight could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Expect very heavy snowfall to occur between 4 PM and 10 PM EST this evening. During that period, snowfall rates of 1 to 2 to possibly as much as 3 inches per hour will occur at times, making travel especially difficult.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
